name: Geisha Girl, size A5 148mm (h) x 210mm (w)
description:
Mr Kobo is a North Wales based Artist & Illustrator. Educated in North Wales before completing his degree at the National Centre for Computer Animation (NCCA) in Bournemouth, specialising in character design. His style has evolved over the years, recently taking a turn towards the realms of street art. 
Mr Kobo uses a diverse range of media to express his ideas from large scale murals to stickers, but is most known for his bright and bold character based pieces which are inspired by the people in the world around him, and his personal experience. His character based imagery can be described as flowing, 
light and ethereal, and his style; contemporary and illustrative. 
Mr Kobo continues to focus on developing his unique and fresh style, getting his work up bigger, bolder and brighter, and on adding a new dimension to the contemporary street art scene. www.facebook.com/mrkobo 
www.stickerhappy.co.uk supports and publicises artists and galleries by selling high-quality, limited-edition stickers of their work. We provide you with a funky, ethical and affordable way to buy art. Stick em up on laptops, netbooks, fridges, journals etc. They make the perfect gift, and a reasonable proportion of each sale goes directly to the artist.

name: Pinata, size A5 148mm (h) x 210mm (w)
description:
Polyp is a freelance radical cartoonist, activist and political street theatre propbuilder based in Manchester, whose work has been used by a wide range of NGOs and campaign groups. He was involved in establishing the anticonsumerism/Buy Nothing Day movement in the UK. An active member of the skeptics movement, he has also worked to debunk religious, new age and conspiracy theory myths. www.polyp.org.uk/cartoons.html
Polyps' are both the cute, tentacled little creatures that build coral reefs, and the malignant growths that get up people’s noses.

name: enchanted princess
description:
Simon David Smith
is a primarily self-taught artist from Devonshire. His work is highly
distinctive, embracing innocence, romance and the esoteric; whilst celebrating humanity and our place within the natural world. His distinctive style has gained him a wide range of commissions throughout the UK and beyond; including in the worlds of music and shamanism. http://www.simonsmithart.com

name: untitled accordian man
description:
Nikhil Kirsh is a portrait artist from London who has recently been warmly welcomed into the Reykavik Art scene bringing a perspective he hopes will be part of a New Renaissance. For Nikhil it is the duty of the artists in society to see beyond influences that seek to control the evolution of social consciousness, to subtly and accessibly point ahead a few steps with a perspective that provides inspiration and hope. His recent work is a striking illustration of surrender and reverence to levels of human consciousness that are said to connect us all as one human family. It is with this sentiment that Nikhil’s work has recently found its place in the shifting tides of Icelandic society. www.nikhilkirsh.com
